page.title: 06THE LINTHILL GHAIST
page.content: { THE LINTHILL GHAIST} If ye gan past auld Linthill Hoose ye micht git a right gliff, for they say the ghaist of the wumman murdert in 1751 still hings aboot in a bleed stained dress. Mistress Home, the lady that bid in the big hoose had gan tae bed yin nicht and had scarce shut her een, when a man crept oot frae under her bed where he'd been hidin'. He hoped tae git the keys o' her safe oot the pocket o' her goonie, but she stertit up and gied sic a yell that he lost the heid and stabbed her ower and ower again wi' his clasp knife. The puir wumman managed tae pu' her bell rope afore she died. The murderer, her ain servant, broke his leg jumpin' frae the windae but dragged hissel' intae a field o' peas where he was fund in the mornin'. He was the last man to be hanged in chains in Scotland
